title: Top-level selection mode for atari
description:
# Description
Add a "top-level" selection mode to atari that prioritizes work at the root level of the ownership graph. Instead of picking beads globally by priority, atari selects the highest-priority top-level item (epic or standalone bead) and completes all its ready work before moving to the next.

# Key Decisions
| Decision | Choice |
|----------|--------|
| Default mode | top-level (not global) |
| Top-level includes | Epics AND standalone beads |
| Priority source | Item's own priority field |
| On exhaustion | Clear active, re-select all |
| On all complete | Auto-close epic, move on |
| --epic interaction | --epic takes precedence |
| Persistence | Yes, verify on resume |
| Eager switch default | false (complete before switching) |

# Children
- bd-308: Config options
- bd-3cc: Workqueue selection logic
- bd-btd: State persistence and controller integration
- bd-199: Events and TUI display
- bd-3iw: Init skills for epic priority guidance
- bd-15x: Integration tests
- bd-1h9: Final verification
close_reason: All children complete: config options (bd-308), workqueue selection logic (bd-3cc), state persistence and controller integration (bd-btd), events and TUI display (bd-199), init skills for epic priority guidance (bd-3iw), integration tests (bd-15x), and final verification (bd-1h9). Top-level selection mode is fully implemented and verified.

title: Epic filter for atari start
description:
# Description
Add --epic flag to atari start that restricts work to beads under a specific epic.

# Feature Summary
- CLI flag: `atari start --epic bd-xxx`
- Validates epic exists and is type=epic at startup
- Filters workqueue to only epic descendants (recursive)
- TUI shows "(epic: bd-xxx)" in status line
- Graph dims beads outside epic subtree

# Key Decisions (from user interview)
- CLI flag only, no config file support
- Start command only (not once)
- Full bead ID required (bd-xxx format)
- Fail fast if epic invalid
- All descendants included (recursive)
- Keep polling when epic work done
- Normal retry/backoff rules apply
- Restart required to change epic filter
close_reason: Completed: Added --epic flag to atari start command with validation, workqueue filtering, TUI status display, and graph visualization. All child tasks closed.

title: Implement top-level selection logic in workqueue
description:
# Description
Add the core selection logic for top-level mode in the workqueue package. This identifies root items (epics + standalone beads) and filters to descendants of the selected top-level item.

# Technical Approach
1. Add method to identify top-level items:
   - Query `br list --json` to get all beads
   - Find roots: epics + beads with no parent
   - Sort by priority (ascending), then creation time

2. Add `NextTopLevel()` method to Manager:
   - If activeTopLevel is set and has ready descendants, use it
   - Otherwise, identify all top-level items, pick highest priority with ready work
   - Filter beads to descendants of selected top-level item
   - Apply existing filterEligible logic
   - Return highest priority descendant

3. Track active top-level in Manager struct (runtime state)

4. Handle exhaustion: clear activeTopLevel when no ready descendants

# Key Files
- internal/workqueue/queue.go - main implementation
- internal/workqueue/queue_test.go - unit tests

# Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Top-level items correctly identified (epics + parentless beads)
- [ ] NextTopLevel() selects from active top-level's descendants
- [ ] Exhausted top-level items are cleared
- [ ] Unit tests cover: multi-epic scenarios, standalone beads, exhaustion

# Verification
- [ ] `mise run lint` passes
- [ ] `mise run test` passes

If implementation reveals new issues, create separate issues for investigation.
close_reason: Implemented NextTopLevel() selection mode in workqueue with activeTopLevel tracking, helper methods for identifying/selecting top-level items, and comprehensive tests covering multi-epic, standalone, and exhaustion scenarios. Lint and tests pass.

title: Validate epic at controller startup

# Description
When an epic ID is configured, validate it exists and is type=epic before starting the work loop. Fail fast with clear error if invalid.

# Technical Approach
1. Add validation method to controller that calls `br show <epic-id> --json`
2. Parse response and verify `issue_type == "epic"`
3. If epic doesn't exist or isn't an epic type, return error with clear message
4. Call validation in controller Start() before entering main loop
5. Store validated epic info (ID, title) for TUI display

- internal/workqueue/queue.go - reference for br command execution pattern
